clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Ramosetron in Patients Undergoing Off Pump Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Ramosetron in Patients Undergoing Off Pump Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effects of ramosetron on corrected QT interval in patients undergoing off pump coronary artery bypass surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 240 minutes after induction of general anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: at 1,2,3,5,10,15,30,45,60,90,120,240 minutes after ramosetron injection, at the time of operation end, ICU 12hour

secondary_outcome.measure: hypotension or bradycardia during the peri-induction period and the coronary anastomosis period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 240 minutes after induction of general anesthesia
during the hospital stay (from ICU admission to hospital discharge, average of 1 week)

clinical_study.condition: Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Triple Vessel

arm_group.description: Intravenous administration of ramosetron 0.3 mg before the induction of general anesthesia
Intravenous administration of 2ml normal saline before the induction of general anesthesia

intervention.description: 0.3 mg IV as bolus before induction of general anesthesia
2 ml normal saline as bolus before induction of general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective off-pump coronary artery bypass graft surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency operation
- preoperative use of any inotropics or mechanical assist device
- severe liver disease (>Child class II)
- dialysis dependent renal failure
- Left ventricular ejection fraction <30 %
- Combined major surgery like carotid endarterectomy
- Previous allergy history to any 5-hydroxytryptamine type 3 (5-HT3) antagonist
- Preoperative QT prolongation ( 500 >msec) or arrhythmia
